title: Eastern Medicine Goes West
author: Malia Politzer
cleaned_text: Sept. 14, 2007 12:01 am ET HONG KONG -- I wasn't sure what to expect from a conference promoting the "Modernization of Chinese Medicine and Health Products," but it surely wasn't this. Sitting at a small table amid throngs of international vendors in the Hong Kong convention center, I winced at the pain jolting through my hand. The woman who sat across from me nodded wisely: "You get migraines I see." She gestured to a picture of a hand dotted with pressure points and their associated organs while sliding an electromagnetic stylus across my palm. "Lower back pain." Another jolt of pain, ". . . and you didn't sleep very well last night." Copyright ©2023 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
